009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018
019public class ProjectiveFit2D implements LinearFit2D {
020        
021        private final RealMatrix A;             // the calculated transformation matrix
022        private final double err;               // the calculated error
023        
024        /**
025         * Constructor.
026         * Fits two sequences of 2D points using a projective transformation model.
027         * At least 4 point pairs are required. For 4 point pairs, the solution
028         * is an exact fit, otherwise a least-squares fit is found.
029         * @param P the source points
030         * @param Q the target points
031         */
032        public ProjectiveFit2D(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
033                checkSize(P, Q);
034                final int n = P.length;
035                
036                double[] ba = new double[2 * n];
037                double[][] Ma = new double[2 * n][];
038                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
039                        double px = P[i].getX();
040                        double py = P[i].getY();
041                        double qx = Q[i].getX();
042                        double qy = Q[i].getY();
043                        ba[2 * i + 0] = qx;
044                        ba[2 * i + 1] = qy;
045                        Ma[2 * i + 0] = new double[] { px, py, 1, 0, 0, 0, -qx * px, -qx * py };
046                        Ma[2 * i + 1] = new double[] { 0, 0, 0, px, py, 1, -qy * px, -qy * py };
047                }
048                
049                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Ma);
050                RealVector b = MatrixUtils.createRealVector(ba);
051                DecompositionSolver solver = new SingularValueDecomposition(M).getSolver();
052                RealVector h = solver.solve(b);
053                A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(3, 3);
054                A.setEntry(0, 0, h.getEntry(0));
055                A.setEntry(0, 1, h.getEntry(1));
056                A.setEntry(0, 2, h.getEntry(2));
057                A.setEntry(1, 0, h.getEntry(3));
058                A.setEntry(1, 1, h.getEntry(4));
059                A.setEntry(1, 2, h.getEntry(5));
060                A.setEntry(2, 0, h.getEntry(6));
061                A.setEntry(2, 1, h.getEntry(7));
062                A.setEntry(2, 2, 1.0);
063                
064                err = this.calculateError(P, Q, A);
065        }
066
067        @Override
068        public double[][] getTransformationMatrix() {
069                return A.getData();
070        }
071
072        @Override
073        public double getError() {
074                return err;
075        }
076        
077        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
078        
079        protected static void checkSize(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
080                if (P.length < 4 || Q.length < 4) {
081                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least 4 point pairs are required to calculate this fit");
082                }
083        }
084
085}
